Creating a Grails project with Maven is a bit difficult mainly because the archetype is incomplete. 

  # Create project from Maven Archetype
{{{
 Group Id: org.grails
 Artifact Id: grails-maven-archetype
 Version: 1.2.0
}}}
  # Install missing grails plugins
{{{
mvn grails:install-plugin \-DpluginName=hibernate

mvn grails:install-plugin \-DpluginName=tomcat

mvn grails:install-plugin \-DpluginName=testing
}}}
  # Setup environment variables
{{{
set MAVEN-OPTS=-Xmx512m \-XX:MaxPermSize=256m
}}}
  # Add pom dependencies [GRAILS-5677|http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/GRAILS-5677]
{{{
<dependency>
   <groupId>org.grails</groupId>
   <artifactId>grails-bootstrap</artifactId>
   <version>1.2.0</version>
   <scope>runtime</scope>
</dependency>
<dependency>
   <groupId>javassist</groupId>
   <artifactId>javassist</artifactId>
   <version>3.8.0.GA</version>
   <scope>runtime</scope>
</dependency>
}}}
  # Change pom dependency
{{{
<dependency>
   <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
   <artifactId>slf4j-log4j12</artifactId>
   <version>1.5.x</version> <\!-\- to the version of slf4j-api-1.5.x.jar in Maven Dependencies \-->

</dependency>
}}}
